com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget
Class WPSlidingImageView

java.lang.Object
  View
      com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget.WPSlidingImageView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class WPSlidingImageView
extends View
implements java.lang.Runnable

Windows Phone 7 image "tiles" that transition between supplied images. A custom WPSlidingImageView.SlidingImageAdapter is used whereby you supply an image Bitmap for each position in the adapter. There are listeners for sliding starting and ending. By default images are animated to a random direction and done endlessly.

There are three custom XML attributes for this View:
:animationDuration="integer"
:imageInterval="integer"
:isEndless="boolean"

Change Log:
v1.01

  • Better Semaphore handling.
v1.02
  • Using Scroller instead of Semaphore for translations.

Since:
07-14-2012

          A SavedState which save and load the current index.
static interface WPSlidingImageView.SlideListener
          Use this listener interface to catch slide events.
static interface WPSlidingImageView.SlidingImageAdapter
          Have your WPSlidingImageView.SlidingImageAdapter implement this interface and override the getBitmap method, which will be used by this gallery to display images.

onDraw

public void onDraw(Canvas canvas)
Here is where the drawing of the two (or one) bitmaps occurs. It is fairly simple because the rest of the View controls the (X,Y) values of the current and next image.

canvas -
